Title: Data Journalist Intern
Description:
InternshipDate: Oct 25, 2018
Location: DC, US
Company: Associated Press
The Associated Press is the essential global news network, delivering fast, unbiased news from every corner of the world to all media platforms and formats. Founded in 1846, AP today is the largest and most trusted source of independent news and information. On any given day more than half the world's population sees news from AP.
The Associated Press is offering a paid 12-week full-time summer data journalism internship based in Washington, DC in 2019.
We are a small team of enterprising developer-journalists distributed across the U.S., and together we work on a variety of data-rich news projects – from drilling into data sets for AP investigations, to developing engaging news apps for big stories such as the U.S. elections, to building newsroom tools that enhance our beat and breaking-news reporting.
We are seeking new ways to tell stories, both in words and in pixels, and our data journalist intern will work closely with graphic artists, designers, video journalists, text reporters and editors to find the story in the data and bring it to life across platforms.
Based on experience and current skill set, the intern will be assigned to either the news applications developers team or the data analysts team. A solid foundation, either in solving problems with code or seeking insight in data, will be key to quickly contributing to either team.
The ability to effectively collaborate, both with other data journalists on the team and with reporters and editors around the AP, along with intellectual curiosity and initiative are essential to be successful in this role. In addition, the intern must be comfortable interacting with a diverse group of co-workers and interview subjects.
The intern will be expected to keep up-to-date with news in the city or region and its relevance to national and international.
Training in all formats will include journalism ethics. Interns must become familiar with - and abide by - the AP’s statement of values and principles governing ethics.
Qualifications:
Applicants must be:
current full-time students within two years of earning an undergraduate degree (juniors and seniors) when applying for the program or
current full-time graduate students or
students who graduate December 2018.
Freshmen and sophomores (first and second year students) are not eligible.
Must be able to show proof of legal authorization to participate in a 12-week internship in the U.S. prior to the start of the internship.
Effective data analysis and reporting skills with a track record of developing strong story ideas from data.
Must be familiar with HTML and web standards.
Relevant experience and training in text is required as well as a secondary visual format such as video, photos or interactive/graphics, data visualizations and 3D animations.
Good general knowledge of national and international affairs.
Must have demonstrated proficiency speaking and writing in the English language.
Good writing skills, the ability to recognize grammatical and factual errors and knowledgeable of AP Style.
A prior journalism internship or experience in media.
Knowledge of online and social media news venues.
Highly organized and attentive to detail; able to multi-task and manage projects as assigned.
Self-starter with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.
Submission materials:
A 300-word autobiographical essay on this topic: “The Associated Press seeks to recruit and retain a workforce that embodies a wide range of talents, experiences, achievements and journalistic skills. Please describe the qualities and accomplishments you would bring to the company as an intern.”
A resume and cover letter (please include your projected graduation date).
Three to five examples of your print/text work (links to an online site of your work are highly preferred).
Three to five examples of your data journalism work (links to an online site of your work are highly preferred).
A reference letter from a prior internship, employer or faculty adviser on college/university letterhead.
All application materials should be uploaded simultaneously, including the reference letter.



APPLICATION DEADLINE: December 9, 2018, 11:59 pm EST
AP seeks to build an inclusive organization grounded in respect for differences. We support all aspects of diversity and provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or status as a veteran in accordance with applicable nondiscrimination laws.

Title: Data Entry Intern
Description:
$14 an hourInternshipThe Scholars Strategy Network is looking for a Data Entry Intern to work alongside the Membership & Research team. The Scholars Strategy Network is a one-stop resource that connects journalists, policymakers, and civic leaders to America’s top scholars and their research. Together they inform news and help solve the nation’s toughest policy problems.

Across the country, chapters and scholars volunteer their research, time, and energy. Scholars join the network to become part of a community of leading researchers who are dedicated to improving policy and strengthening democracy.

Through the network, journalists, policymakers, and civic leaders connect with responsive scholars and jargon-free research to support their work.

Job Description
The data intern will be responsible for maintaining network members’ data and web content, as well as assisting staff and other network leaders with easily accessing the various types of membership data required for building and maintaining strong relationships with the network’s growing membership. The data intern, as with all staff, will occasionally be called on to support other departments’ fast-moving projects. Additional responsibilities can range from compiling outreach lists to coordinating event logistics, to printing and collating.

The position requires a commitment of 15-20 hours per week. Additional hours may become available. Hourly pay is $14 per hour.

The ideal candidate would start immediately and work until the end of March 2019. Start and end dates are negotiable. Once hired, the intern will be expected to train in-person or acquire the necessary technology to be brought up to speed via screen sharing and video conferencing.

The Scholars Strategy Network’s National Office is currently located near Inman Square at 1035 Cambridge Street Cambridge, MA 02139. The data intern will report to Ben Miyamoto, the Director of Membership & Research. Work schedule is relatively flexible and will be discussed in the interview process. Training must be done in person, however, remote work is possible once trained.

Responsibilities
Supporting the Research & Policy Team in creating and maintaining web content including but not limited to: two-page policy briefs, member profiles, and website spotlights

Updating the member database (Podio)
Tracking data on recruitment, member scholars, and additional areas as identified
Proofreading and editing (and occasionally drafting) member profiles
Assisting network staff and chapter leaders with strategic recruitment
Working with communications staff to create and send newsletters and other outgoing member communications
Completing additional duties as assigned
Requirements
Meticulous attention to detail

Strong organizational skills and the ability to managing multiple projects at once

A commitment to the network’s mission and vision

Excellent interpersonal communication skills
Excellent written communication skills
Enthusiasm for learning
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Google Docs, Dropbox
Ability to adapt to new data and information systems
Self-motivation and a positive, professional attitude
Interest in managing information systems and excited by problem-solving

Title: Product Management Intern Summer 2019
Description:
Temporary, InternshipAt BuzzFeed we are trying to build a new kind of media company that brings our audience content that they deeply connect with and want to share with the people who matter most in their lives. The product management team is responsible for leading product strategy and driving execution towards this mission.

Our product management internship is for anyone eager to gain experience building products that solve real problems. During your summer internship you'll work closely with engineering, design and data science on a project that you'll launch by the end of the summer. Throughout your summer you'll get the chance to learn from and be mentored by some experienced product managers while working in close collaboration with world-class video producers, journalists and social media managers.

Read this blog post ( https://tech.buzzfeed.com/we-were-the-2018-buzzfeed-intern-class-and-now-were-crying-in-the-club-because-summer-s-over-dba1dcb85e0a ) to learn more about last summer's intern class or this post ( https://tech.buzzfeed.com/11-ways-to-have-an-awesome-internship-at-buzzfeed-ef28bd3a3dfd ) to learn more about the internship.

About You:

You have a sincere interest in product management and want to expand your skills in the field.
You have proven your genuine love for technology by working on on tech projects (in class or in the real world).
You are a self-starter who is comfortable taking initiative when given a project to work on.
You're a problem solver who loves to get your hands dirty solving problems using research and data.

Qualifications:

Your resume demonstrates your passion for building products through experience, or coursework.
Proven leadership experience where you've worked closely with cross-functional teams to tackle large projects
Excellent communication skills that allow you to easily collaborate with both technical and non-technical team members
Bonus points if you have any experience working in the media or tech industries or on projects relating to apps, website development, or social media. We love hearing about passion projects outside of school, too.

What We'll Offer:

A project that will give you an opportunity to solve a real problem for BuzzFeed!
Mentorship from experienced product managers.
A unique culture of collaboration, hard work, and fun.
Meaningful interactions with cross-functional teams.

Life at BuzzFeed:
At BuzzFeed, we believe our work benefits from the diverse perspectives of our employees. As such, BuzzFeed celebrates inclusion and is committed to equal opportunity employment. As a BuzzFeed employee, you can expect:


A supportive, inclusive atmosphere on a team that values your contributions
Opportunities for personal and professional growth via work experience, offerings from our in-house Learning Team, Employee Resource Groups, and more
No shortage of snacks, catered lunches, beverages, birthday treats... even leftovers from the Tasty kitchen!

Requirements:

You must be legally eligible to work in the US.
You must be graduating in December 2019 or later.
You must be onsite in NYC June 3rd - August 23rd 2019.
You'll be paid fairly, inline with tech industry standards.

Title: Editorial Intern- Everyday Health
Description:
InternshipEverydayHealth.com, the leading health and wellness digital platform, seeks interns with strong reporting, writing, SEO, and digital media skills to join our close-knit, mission-driven editorial team.
The right candidate will have the opportunity to work in a creative, fast-paced environment with award-winning health and medical journalists. Editorial interns will research and develop story pitches for publication, gain experience interviewing health experts and representatives, learn how to identify journal articles for use in stories, engage with our audience on social media, and gain insights into SEO best-practices and how to build a knowledge network on the Internet. While this paid internship is based in our lower Manhattan offices, we will work around the right candidate’s schedule, recognizing that education comes first. At the end of the internship, the successful candidate will have earned reporting credit and bylines.
Pitch story ideas on health topics including nutrition, fitness, wellness, heart health, diabetes, cancer, multiple sclerosis, and sleep
Assist with social media
Promote stories to PR representatives and bloggers
Assist with research and fact checking
Develop strategies to build our online knowledge network
Support the overall production needs of the website

The IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL POSSESS
Currently enrolled in an accredited university/college program or recently graduated from an accredited university/college program
A keen instinct for news and storytelling
Strong writing, editing and fact-checking skills
Interest in and knowledge of digital media

Who We Are
Everyday Health attracts a large and engaged audience of over 46 million consumers and over 730,000 practicing physicians in the U.S. to its premier health and wellness properties, and utilizes its data and analytics expertise to deliver highly personalized content experiences and efficient and effective marketing and engagement solutions. Everyday Health enables consumers to manage their daily health and wellness needs, healthcare professionals to stay informed and make better decisions for their patients, and marketers, health payers and providers to communicate and engage with consumers and healthcare professionals to drive better health outcomes. Everyday Health’s content and solutions are delivered through multiple channels, including desktop, mobile web, and mobile phone and tablet applications, as well as video and social media.

Title: Sports Intern
Description:
InternshipDate: Oct 25, 2018
Location: NY, US
Company: Associated Press
The Associated Press is the essential global news network, delivering fast, unbiased news from every corner of the world to all media platforms and formats. Founded in 1846, AP today is the largest and most trusted source of independent news and information. On any given day more than half the world's population sees news from AP.
The Associated Press is offering a paid 12-week summer internship at its Sports desk based in New York in 2019.
The AP Sports Intern will contribute to AP’s content in all formats and will receive experience and training in text, video, images and social media production. Based upon skillset, interactive production may be included. The intern will attend sporting events, where he or she will work with journalists of all formats.
The intern will be expected to be a fast thinker and show creativity and strong news judgment. A successful candidate will be able to suggest story ideas and angles and see storytelling potential in video, images and text. The intern should be comfortable interacting with a diverse group of co-workers and interview subjects.
The intern will be expected to keep up-to-date with sports news around the world, and its relevance to other areas, including general news, business news, politics and entertainment. Responsibilities will include tracking down information, conducting interviews, monitoring and using social media to find stories and to promote AP’s content, tracking down user-generated content and covering breaking stories and sports events, either by phone or going to the scene.
The intern will also work with the desk editors, working on content from around the world, enhancing top stories with multimedia content for AP’s web sites and mobile applications. The intern will also be expected to pitch multimedia enterprise story ideas, and execute at least one during the internship.
The intern will assist in the production of video sports stories and work closely with photographers on visual storytelling techniques. Where possible, the intern will accompany staff photographers on assignments, assist with arrangements in the field, and shoot photos.
An intern with a background in interactive/graphics/data visualizations may assist in creating stories told through multimedia elements.
The intern will be trained how to transform complex concepts into immersive and visual stories that users can quickly understand.
Training in all formats will include journalism ethics. The intern must become familiar with - and abide by - the AP’s statement of values and principles governing ethics.
Qualifications:
Applicants must be:
current full-time students within two years of earning an undergraduate degree (juniors and seniors) when applying or
current full-time graduate students or
students who graduate December 2018.
Freshmen and sophomores (first and second year students) are ineligible.
Must be able to show proof of legal authorization to participate in a 12-week internship in the United States prior to the start of the internship.
Relevant experience and training in text is required as well as a secondary visual format such as video, photos or interactive/graphics.
Must have demonstrated proficiency speaking and writing in the English language.
Good general knowledge of national and international affairs.
Good writing skills, the ability to recognize grammatical and factual errors and knowledgeable of AP Style.
Must have a keen interest and/or experience in sports.
A prior journalism internship or experience in media.
Knowledge of online and social media news venues.
Highly organized and attentive to detail; able to multi-task and manage projects as assigned.
Self-starter with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.
Submission materials:
A 300-word autobiographical essay on this topic: “The Associated Press seeks to recruit and retain a workforce that embodies a wide range of talents, experiences, achievements and journalistic skills. Please describe the qualities and accomplishments you would bring to the company as an intern.”
A resume and cover letter (please include your projected graduation date).
Three to five examples of your related text work (links to an online site of your work are highly preferred).
Three to five examples of your visual work - video, photos, multimedia, interactive, etc. (links to an online site of your work are highly preferred).
A reference letter from a prior internship or employer.
All application materials should be uploaded simultaneously, including the reference letter.


APPLICATION DEADLINE: DECEMBER 9, 2018, 11:59 p.m. EST.
AP seeks to build an inclusive organization grounded in respect for differences. We support all aspects of diversity and provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or status as a veteran in accordance with applicable nondiscrimination laws.

Title: Fellowship -- Editor/Graphics
Description:
Join the 2019 New York Times Fellowship class as a graphics editor.

The core of the graphics fellowship is the intersection of data visualization and journalism. Fellows will work closely with graphics editors and department leaders to develop skills and judgment as reporters and shapers of visual stories. As part of daily news coverage or enterprise projects, fellows will report, write, edit, design and produce interactive graphics and multimedia across all Times platforms.

The graphics desk covers all subjects, from economics and elections to culture and sports. Strong candidates will also be curious about all of it, coming to the newsroom with lots of ideas and with great enthusiasm for potential lines of reporting.

The most competitive candidates will be interested in data visualization, cartography or other forms of visual journalism, and they will have investigated or developed skills to start producing work in these areas. The pool of candidates will mainly consist of college graduates, postgraduates or budding journalists of any age who have had previous news internships or equivalent experience.

This is a guild position.

Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States. The deadline to submit an application for this yearlong program is 11:59 p.m., New York time on November 19, 2018.

For more information about the Times Fellowship, navigate here: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/jobs/times-fellowship.html

The New York Times is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce, one that reflects the varied global community we serve. Our journalism and the products we build in the service of that journalism greatly benefit from a range of perspectives, which can only come from diversity of all types, across our ranks, at all levels of the organization. Achieving true diversity and inclusion is the right thing to do. It is also the smart thing for our business. So we strongly encourage women, veterans, people with disabilities, people of color and gender nonconforming candidates to apply.

The New York Times Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual's sex, age, race, color, creed, national origin, alienage, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation or affectional preference, gender identity and expression, disability, genetic trait or predisposition, carrier status, citizenship, veteran or military status and other personal characteristics protected by law. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected characteristics.

Title: WAMU Spring 2019 Internship Program
Description:
$15 an hourPart-time, InternshipDesired: JournalismWAMU Spring 2019 Internship Program

Working alongside the professional staff of WAMU, interns contribute to the day-to-day operations of the station. As a WAMU intern, you will also be provided access to training opportunities within the station by editorial and production staff and from professionals around the D.C. metro area, including the talented staff at NPR.
To be eligible for an internship at WAMU 88.5, you must be 18 or older and authorized to work in the United States. All interns are paid $15 per hour. The amount received during the internship is based on hours per week and the length of the internship period. Interns are expected to work about 20-25 hours per week (one exception: any student interns affiliated with American University may not exceed 20 hours per week). Schedules will be determined once an offer is made. Academic credit can also be received for an internship.
Applications for the Winter/Spring internship program must be submitted by Sunday, November 18 at 11:59 p.m. EST. Internships will start January 14, 2019 and run through April 5, 2019.
You can find more information about the WAMU 88.5 Internship Program at the Program Website.



Available Internships

We are pleased to offer four internship opportunities this Spring:
1A
DCist
The Kojo Nnamdi Show
WAMU 88.5 News



Internship Professional Development Opportunities

Interns will recieve the following professional development benefits as part of the Internship Program:
Weekly professional development activities
Access to American University’s staff trainings and wellness programs
Invitations to staff networking events



1A Internship Description and Requirements

1A is produced by WAMU and distributed by NPR. We explore the most compelling and relevant DCissues emerging in policy, politics, technology, sports, pop culture, and humor—with an emphasis on what connects us and what keeps us apart. Our goal is to act as a national mirror—helping America look at itself and find time to ask itself what it wants to be. The live show airs Monday–Friday from 10 a.m.–12 p.m. EST. We produce a daily show for on-demand audiences, as well as a shorter daily podcast.
Interns can expect a hands-on experience. From day one, they will contribute to the production of the program and work alongside the 1A team. They will produce on-air and online stories, conduct research, pitch stories, and help live-stream certain shows.
Our interest in you should be matched by your interest in us. You will be among those committed to upholding the highest standards of radio and online journalism.
Key responsibilities:
Pitch story ideas
Share content online
Attend the daily editorial meeting
Produce on-air and online stories
Conduct research for stories
Support the administrative and tech needs of the show
Write up interviews
Qualifications:
Creative thinker
Ability to report and tell many kinds of stories
Ability to juggle multiple tasks with accuracy and efficiency and work well with all staff
Excellent research skills
Ability to work under deadline pressure
Strong written and oral communication skills
Preferred skills:
Some reporting and broadcast experience
Knowledge of WAMU and NPR programming
Digital media skills



DCist Internship Description and Requirements

DCist aims to be the homepage of the District—publishing breaking local news, feature stories, tales of local curiosities, event guides, and other useful information for a large audience. Our tone is both playful and authoritative; we know and care about the city, and hope that you do, too.
We're looking for an energetic, creative journalist who is excited about digging into the city’s stories in any of our coverage areas: news (including local politics, transportation, inequality, housing, and other beats), arts, and food. We’re a small team, and interns will participate in nearly all aspects of what we do every day.
Key responsibilities:
Developing story ideas
Reporting and writing
Conducting research
Posting on DCist’s social media channels and contributing to our newsletter
Qualifications:
Interest in local news, and D.C. specifically
Ability to work under quick deadlines
Prior journalism experience or coursework
Preferred skills:
Photography, video, data journalism, graphic design, or other digital media skills



The Kojo Nnamdi Show Internship Description and Requirements

The Kojo Nnamdi Show is produced by WAMU. The show is a live local talk program that highlights local news, political issues and social trends of the day and includes listener’s calls, emails and tweets. The show airs Monday through Thursday from noon to 1 p.m. EST.
On Friday, The Politics Hour airs from noon to 1 p.m. EST with resident analyst Tom Sherwood. The program connects the dots between events happening in Washington, D.C., and the state houses in Annapolis, Maryland, and Richmond, Virginia.
Interns support all editorial aspects of the program. They conduct research on show topics, craft questions that are folded into host scripts, pitch story ideas, help with phone screening and live events.
We're looking for creative people who are passionate about learning more about the Washington region through a local lens, and what it means to do local journalism. Our ideal candidate is curious about using a talk format to engage a local audience with captivating stories.
Key responsibilities:
Conduct research on show topics
Craft questions
Attend daily editorial meeting
Help with phone screening
Pitch story ideas
Support the administrative needs of the show
Qualifications:
Strong written and oral skills
Well-read with abroad interests in literature, politics, sciences, arts, and entertainment
Resourceful and motivated
Excellent research skills
Ability to respond to feedback and editorial direction
Preferred skills:
Some reporting and broadcast experience
Knowledge of WAMU and NPR programming
Digital media skills
Audio editing skills



WAMU 88.5 Newsroom Internship Description and Requirements

The WAMU 88.5 news team is seeking aspiring journalists and college or graduate students with a keen interest in local news in the Washington region to work as paid interns in our local public media newsroom. As a growing multiplatform newsroom in a fast-changing place, we cover issues ranging from transportation and the arts to power and influence and education. We’re working constantly to adapt our storytelling and distribution methods to meet audience demands and shifting expectations. Interns will be exposed to all aspects of our news operation: developing story ideas, reporting, writing, editing audio and creating content for the web and social media. We hope to impart the skills you will need to actively participate in these operations. And we hope you’ll develop a lasting interest in public media news—as a community member or an employee.
Key responsibilities:
Develop story ideas
Reporting
Writing
Produce content for on-air and online
Conduct research for stories
Qualifications:
Interest in public media
An active interest in news and current affairs—especially in the local community
Ability to respond to feedback and editorial direction
Coursework in journalism, history, politics, international relations, or similar subjects
Preferred skills:
Some reporting and broadcast experience
Strong written and oral communication skills
Digital media skills (photography, data, social media, video, etc.)



Other Information

For more information about WAMU 88.5 please see our website.


Current American University Employees:
If you are a current full-time or part-time staff member at American University, please log into AsuccessfulU through the myAU portal. Once in AsuccessfulU, please select the Careers tile which will take you to our internal career page.

Contact Us:
For more information or assistance with the American University careers site, email theworkline@american.edu.

American University is an equal opportunity, affirmative action institution that operates in compliance with applicable laws and regulations. The university does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, sex (including pregnancy), age, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, personal appearance, gender identity and expression, family responsibilities, political affiliation, source of income, veteran status, an individual’s genetic information or any other bases under federal or local laws (collectively "Protected Bases") in its programs and activities.

Title: Communications & Public Relations Spring Internship
Company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Rhode Island
Description:
Part-time, InternshipAs a BCBSRI communications and public/community relations intern, the student will work on a variety of projects within the departments of internal communications and community/public relations. Interns will gain experience focused in media relations, internal communications, public relations, and social media.

Interns are treated as team members and given tasks that provide them with the ability to grow in their future professional careers. Student(s) must be willing to travel to the BCBSRI corporate office at 500 Exchange Street, Providence, a minimum of twice a week/15 hours per week. After interning, each student will leave with a portfolio of work completed throughout the internship experience. This is an unpaid position that will afford academic credit for an undergraduate program. A full application includes a cover letter and resume.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Works with the public relations department on initiatives including drafting and executing on releases, media advisories, talking points, social media content, external campaigns, etc.
Works with the community relations department on various projects that might include interacting with the nonprofit/charitable sector in RI, drafting employee communications, conducting online research, data entry, coordinating volunteer events/logistics, and contributing to idea development for project execution.
Works with the internal communications department on initiatives including drafting and executing on internal event planning, drafting employee communications, talking points, intranet content, flyers/posters, etc.
Assists with increasing visibility on social media platforms, including Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram for the corporate channels.
Builds and maintains relevant local and national media lists.
Provides assistance during events and event planning/prep.
Works with other internal "clients" to facilitate the completion of internal projects.


QUALIFICATIONS:
Minimum Education and Experience:
Must be currently enrolled in a degree program, ideally in Marketing, Communications, Writing, or Public Relations.
Currently in good standing with a 3.0 minimum cumulative GPA.


Required Knowledge, Skills, and/or Abilities:
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Excellent written, verbal, analytical, and research skills.
Proficiency in all Microsoft Office applications.
Highly technical and detail-oriented abilities.
Strong attention to detail.
Southern New England, Boston, MA, Hartford, CT, Health Data Analyst, RI Health Insurer, Healthcare, Wellness, Provider, Network, Rhode Island, RI, Intern, Internship, Student, Marketing, Marketer, American Marketing Association, Business Communication, Public Relations, PRSA, IABC, Communicator, Journalism, Journalist

Title: Spring Media Research Intern
Description:
Part-time, InternshipSummary

The Intern, Media Research will help the media and communications team build relationships with U.S. media and bloggers, conducting media research, developing and updating media contact lists for various initiatives and campaigns. The intern will also complete a media research project which will be presented to the Communications Team at the conclusion of the internship.

Responsibilities

Research and update media lists for pitching and outreach to US journalists.
Support Media Analyst in tracking media coverage of Save the Children.
Research media trends that will support strategy for future media efforts around major campaigns and events.
Assist in analysis of media coverage data.
Other related tasks as needed.


Requirements
Data analysis and familiarity with Excel.
Strong critical thinking, problem solving and analysis skills.
Excellent organizational and time management skills; detail oriented with thorough research skills.
Current enrollment in 4 year Bachelor's program. Communications, Journalism, Public Relations or related degrees preferred.
Possess strong written skills, solid interpersonal skills and ability to work within a team.
Proficient in Microsoft Office.
Eligible to work in the U.S.
To be classified as an intern: an individual must be enrolled in a relevant undergraduate, graduate or post-graduate academic program and able to receive credit from his/her college or institution. (Minimum requirement is a letter of support and documentation is required only after an internship is offered.)
An individual who is not enrolled as a student may apply for an internship, but will be classified as a skilled volunteer, not as an intern.
Please attach resume and cover letter to your application


What’s In It for You

Structured learning and development program
Meaningful work under the direct supervision of an experienced Save the Children staff member
Highly collaborative and innovative teams
Networking program with managers across the organization
Flexible schedule
A family friendly work environment
The knowledge that the work you are supporting is changing the lives of children all around the world
Classification

Unpaid Intern or Skilled Volunteer
Part-time: 20 hours/week
Dates: January 29 to April 26, 2019
Save the Children does NOT provide housing or transportation

Save the Children believes every child deserves a future. In the United States and around the world, we give children a healthy start in life, the opportunity to learn and protection from harm. We do whatever it takes for children – every day and in times of crisis – transforming their lives and the future we share.

Save the Children is committed to conducting its programs and operations in a manner that is safe for the children it serves and helping protect the children with whom Save the Children is in contact. All Save the Children Representatives are explicitly prohibited from engaging in any activity that may result in any kind of Child Abuse. In addition, it is Save the Children’s policy to create and proactively maintain an environment that aims to prevent and deter any actions and omissions, whether deliberate or inadvertent, that place children at the risk of any kind of Child Abuse. All Save the Children Representatives are expected to conduct themselves in a manner consistent with this commitment and obligation. Any violations of this policy will be treated as a serious issue.

Title: Asst. Leveraged Loan Analyst
Description:
Desired: ExcelMicrosoft WordMicrosoft PowerpointAsst. Leveraged Loan Analyst

The Location: New York

The Team: Leveraged Commentary & Data (LCD) has more than three dozen journalists and analysts providing news and research on the leveraged finance markets to 80,000 plus subscribers worldwide. We are a leading information provider whose success hinges upon producing a best-in-class data and research product.
We are responsible for maintaining LCD’s databases, ensuring that not only is information entered in a timely fashion, but also with the utmost attention to accuracy and quality. The team currently resides in New York and London, with expansion opportunities to Charlottesville, Virginia.

The Impact: As an analyst, you will handle all aspects of data management, including the secondary market data behind LCD's loan indexes, the primary market data behind LCD’s market technicals and investor market data (BDCs, CLOs, etc.). Management of this data is a cornerstone to LCD’s unique content and maintaining our position in market.

What’s in it for you:

Do you love data? In this role, expect to:
Develop your analytical skills and research abilities
Explore a highly-rewarding career path with room for professional growth, recognition and rewards
Learn from industry-leading analysts and authorities

Responsibilities:
Provide support to the analytical team by building & updating leveraged loan and high yield bond profiles in LCD’s proprietary database based upon bank books and prospectuses gathered from the market.
Bring together information from market sources such as SEC filings, Ratings Direct, CapitalIQ, and update LCD’s related databases and analysis.
Develop an understanding LCD’s production processes for its research reports and analysis.
Support senior analysts and other group members for varied data collection processes and analysis.
Build your knowledge of the basics of the leveraged finance markets including loans and high yield bonds. This includes the mechanics of the markets, syndication processes and documentation.

What We’re Looking For:

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors’ degree in finance or accounting, or equivalent experience
Strong attention to detail, particularly with regards to the ability to accurately handle data.
Ability to be an independent self-starter in a fast-paced environment.
Intellectual curiosity and dedication to learn about financial markets.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word and Power Point. Access is a plus.

Preferred Qualifications:
Internship experience in finance, economics, or related field
Knowledge of economic and accounting principles and practices, the financial markets, banking and the analysis and reporting of financial data
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions on the basis of merit, capability and equality of opportunity, and without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law, or any other characteristic that has no bearing on a person’s ability to perform his or her job.


Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment. If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.


The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

Title: Spring Intern: Open Source Policy Center
Description:
InternshipOverview
The Open Source Policy Center (OSPC) is making policy analysis more transparent, trustworthy, and collaborative. We incubate and contribute to open-source projects that build tools for economic policy analysis. Our focus for the last five years has been incubating cutting-edge economic models (and user interfaces for those models) for analyzing tax and benefit programs. Our user list includes Democratic and Republican presidential administrations, congressional offices, and presidential campaigns, as well as journalists, students, members of the open source community around the country, and the general public. To learn more about OSPC, please visit our website: www.ospc.org.

OSPC is looking to hire an intern with the following qualifications:
Programming experience (Preferably, but not necessarily, with Python)
General knowledge of econometrics, statistics, and working with data
Strong interest in public policy and open science, open data, or open source software generally
A desire to learn intrapreneurship and operations inside a leading institution like AEI

As an intern for OSPC, you will be a contributor to open-source projects like TaxData and Tax-Calculator. You will also provide general research assistance to other OSPC team members. You can expect to gain experience with web development and solving data analytics, engineering, and modeling problems within the context of public policy.

If you would like to share any software projects you have completed in the past or are working on now, please include your GitHub handle in your resume or cover letter (optional).

About AEI Internships
AEI internships offer a unique opportunity for undergraduates, graduate students, and recent graduates to gain experience in research, writing, business, and communications at one of the nation’s leading think tanks. Competitive candidates for these internships will generally possess a 3.4 GPA from a top ranking college or university.
AEI internships last a minimum of 10 weeks and interns are required to work 20-40 hours per week. AEI internships are unpaid; however, interns receive complimentary breakfast and lunch each day and a monthly transportation stipend to assist with commuting costs.

Title: Director, Career Development
Description:
Job Information
Job Summary:
The Director of Career Development is a senior member of the IOP’s team and is charged with creating and promoting programs, internships and career opportunities across a broad array of political and public service sectors that help University of Chicago students gain exposure to these fields and advance their professional goals. He/she plays a key role in the operation of these and other IOP programs and represents the IOP to a broad range of diverse constituencies on campus and off.
At the heart of these efforts is the IOP’s acclaimed student internship program, featuring paid, substantive opportunities for hundreds of undergraduate and graduate students every academic year and summer. The Director of Career Development is charged with leading all such programs, recruiting employer partners domestically and internationally, and managing relationships with these 300+ employer partners. He/she collaborates with various University offices and divisions to ensure such opportunities are advertised to students through University systems and that applications are managed in a clear and transparent manner. He/she also oversees and administers the Charles H. Percy Summer in Washington program, which provides a comprehensive set of panels, programs, speakers, and social events for the 80+ UChicago IOP interns working in Washington, DC every summer.

In addition, the Director of Career Development leads other IOP efforts year-round to expand student career knowledge, career networks and professional skill sets. The Director provides one-on-one career advising to University undergraduate and graduate students, as well as manages a series of career development workshops featuring practitioners from a variety of public service fields. The Director plans and oversees the annual career development trip to Washington, DC, in which students attend site visits and meetings with government officials, policymakers, journalists, and advocates. He/she also manages the IOP’s Alumni Engagement initiative.

The Director of Career Development reports to the IOP’s Executive Director and manages a Program Coordinator and the Career Development intern. He/she works closely with other IOP program areas on cross-programmatic initiatives and projects. The Director collaborates with a wide array of University departments and divisions, including the University’s Office of Career Advancement. In addition, the Director is responsible for planning and managing the entire internship program budget, as well as writing and preparing annual reports for internship program funders.

Responsibilities:
Lead all aspects of the IOP’s career development efforts, including its flagship summer internship program, the IOP summer stipend program, the Urban Policy and Research Program (UPReP), employer relations, career advising, student mentorship and professional development programming
Establish relationships with a wide range of employer partners and ensure compliance with University and employer policies.
Create and lead supplemental programs that strengthen students’ professional skill sets and networks, including workshops, site visits, and career development international and domestic trips.
Identify and secure internship opportunities for the Institute of Politics (IOP) summer internship program through targeted research, networking and employer relationship development and management.
Manage internship postings and applications via UChicago’s job boards, through which students apply for internships.
Work collaboratively with UChicago Urban Labs to design and manage all aspects of the Urban Policy and Research Program (UPReP).
Coordinate with all relevant campus offices to help ensure internal processes are correct and comply with University policies.
Supervise the Charles H. Percy Summer in Washington program, overseeing student interns and staff to create a comprehensive set of panels, programs, speakers, and social events for UChicago summer interns in their respective cities.
Plan, manage and monitor program budget and expenditures.
Serve as direct supervisor of the Career Development Program Coordinator.
Oversee the IOP Alumni Engagement Initiative and liaise with alumni co-chairs regarding programming and communications.
Work closely with the Director of Communications to develop promotional materials and outreach strategies for all student career development programs.
Organize report-back events with summer interns in the year following their internships.
Coordinate hiring of all Institute of Politics house interns.
Work with Executive Director to develop fundraising strategy for internship and career development programs; support efforts to connect with donors, solicit major gifts, and prepare donor and grant reports.
Manage the database of contact information and other details about the Institute of Politics summer internships; ensure that all data is current, comprehensive, and correct.
Develop tracking and data systems to ensure employer relationships and the internship program as a whole can operate efficiently and smoothly from one year to the next.
Perform other duties and special projects as assigned.

Competencies:
Passion for and knowledge of politics, public service, and civic engagement
Experience working with students and/or in an education setting, preferably in higher education
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively, effectively, and creatively in a team environment with a wide range of constituencies including students, high-profile guests, senior leaders, Board members, colleagues, and leaders across campus and in the broader community
Ability to work with confidential information, use discretion and demonstrate sensitivity in regard to student/employer/participant issues
Demonstrated leadership and mentorship abilities
Superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal skills
Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multi-task with deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Ability to solve problems and make decisions effectively
Excellent organizational and project management skills, along with a superb eye for detail
Strong sense of ethics, fairness, and service to others
Willingness to approach contentious issues from all possible sides, with an eye towards fairness and inclusion
Strong commitment to diversity
Willingness and ability to undertake moderate travel and occasionally flexible work hours


Additional Requirements
Education, Experience or Certifications:
Education:
Bachelor’s degree required, Advanced degree preferred

Experience:
Minimum 5-7 years of experience working in educational, civic engagement or career development capacities
Experience managing others

Required Documents:
Resume
Cover Letter
NOTE : When applying, all required documents MUST be uploaded under the Resume/CV section of the application.


Benefit Eligibility
Yes

Title: Jr. Content Marketer and Promoter (Harrisburg, PA)
Description:
$33,000 - $36,000 a yearPart-timeDesired: CopywritingHTML5Customer ServiceKeyword ResearchMarketingBloggingSEOAre you interested in working on the WebFX Internet marketing team? Then we're interested in you! Check out this page to learn more about being a Jr. Content Marketer and Promoter.
The position at a glance:
Location: Harrisburg
Type: Full Time
Compensation: $33k to $36k (potentially higher based on work experience)

If you think you're a good fit, fill out an application form below!
What We're Looking For
Desired Education
Bachelors in Marketing, Advertising, Journalism, PR, Communications, Information Science, Business or related major
GPA above a 3.4
General Knowledge
Solid understanding of the Internet, copywriting, customer service and Internet technologies
Basic understanding of keyword research and selection (Desired)
Basic understanding of SEO (Desired)
Experience
General web marketing experience
Internship/part-time/summer job/ experience are a plus
Blogging experience (Desired)
Basic HTML or image editing experience (Desired)
Customer service experience in any industry (Desired)
Administrator/moderator of a forum or blog (A bonus)
“Power” Twitter, Google+, Reddit, HackerNews, etc account (Ex. Defined as 500+ followers)(A huge bonus)
Qualities
Outstanding written communication skills
Demonstrates ability to get things done
Continuously follows up on content placement pitches that weren’t successful the first or second time
Facebook account with over 100 friends (Only used to verify web understanding)
Twitter account with over 50 followers (Only used to verify web understanding)
Google+ account with over 10 circles (Desired)(Only used to verify web understanding)er
What You'll Do
Responsibilities
Coordination of content creation and placement
Build relationships with bloggers, publishers, and journalists based on our clients’ industries
Research and pitch created content ideas to bloggers, publishers, and journalists
Learn, test, and implement new SEO content and linking best practices
Post original content relevant to our clients’ keywords and SEO campaigns
Generate ideas and conduct research for infographics, motion graphics, blog posts and other viral content
Uses web analytics to determine the impact of content campaigns
Ability to manage content creation workflow
Ability to think critically and creatively to pitch content based on our clients’ SEO keywords
Ability to meet and exceed monthly production goals
Client interaction: The Jr. Content Marketer role is not a client-facing position for the first few years
Percentage Breakdown
35% building relationships with publishers
20% branding
15% analytics/data analysis
10% online asset research and topic discovery
10% writing
5% reporting
5% social media

Title: WWD: Editorial Internship Spring
Description:
InternshipEditorial Internship – WWD
This internship is for college credit only.

WWD is seeking an intern for the Winter/Spring 2019 semester to engage in training and practical learning experiences with its editorial department in New York. Often referred to as “the fashion bible,” WWD provides a balance of timely, credible business news and key fashion trends to a dedicated readership of retailers, designers, manufacturers, marketers, financiers, Wall Street analysts, international moguls, media executives, ad agencies, socialites, and trend-makers.
This internship offers hands-on experience and shadowing professionals at a reputable and fast-paced industry-leading publication. Interns will learn from and get practical learning experiences from established journalists. This internship is best suited to students with an understanding and passion for journalism.

Interns will have the opportunity to hone their journalism skills and build a portfolio of their work. The learning experiences and activities of this internship are designed to enrich the intern with valuable skills transferable to the intern’s future career.
Interns will learn from the Eye desk, which covers art, culture and society for the publication. The intern will monitor trending stories on social media and WWD traffic trends; transcribe interviews; cover industry events and occasional fact-checking and research.

Strong writing skills are essential as is a familiarity with relevant social media platforms (Instagram, Reddit, Twitter, etc.) and WordPress. An avid interest and keen understanding of New York society, art, restaurants as well as previous internship experience is preferred.

The Winter/Spring Internship will start January 28, 2019 and will run for 12 weeks.

WWD’s parent company, Penske Media Corporation (PMC), is a leading digital media company, publishing, and information services company founded in 2003.

About WWD:
For 100+ years WWD, a property of Fairchild Fashion Media, has been the daily media of record—and THE industry voice of authority—for senior executives in the global women’s and men’s fashion, retail and beauty communities, while also keeping informed the consumer media that cover the market. Often referred to as “the fashion bible,” WWD provides a balance of timely, credible business news and key fashion trends to a dedicated readership of retailers, designers, manufacturers, marketers, financiers, Wall Street analysts, international moguls, media executives, ad agencies, socialites, and trend-makers. As an increasingly complex marketplace heightens the need for information and competitive intelligence, WWD delivers with frequency, integrity, independence, spirited coverage, and a long tradition that demands staffers get the story right and that they also get it first.

About PMC:
Penske Media Corporation (PMC) is a leading digital media and information services company whose award-winning content attracts a monthly audience of more than 180 million and empowers more than 1 million global CEOs and business thought-leaders in markets that impact the world. Our dynamic events, data services, and rich content entertain and educate today’s fashion, retail, beauty, entertainment and lifestyle sectors. Headquartered in New York and Los Angeles with additional offices in 11 countries worldwide, Penske Media is the way global influencers are informed, connected, and inspired. To learn more about PMC and its iconic brands, visit www.pmc.com.

Title: Digital Content Journalist Internship (Unpaid)
Description: InternshipAre you a journalism major looking for real-world experience and internship credit? Healthjump is looking to add an intern to our team, with the possibility of full-time employment following graduation from a four-year college or university.Healthjump’s platform gives healthcare organizations a powerful way to use, share and understand their data. By combining stored and real-time data from many systems, Healthjump solves interoperability challenges that plague the business of healthcare.We have an office in Philadelphia, but this position can be done remotely with no travel to the office required.Internship description: Healthjump is looking for a talented and enthusiastic content creator/journalist intern to research, write and produce engaging content to expand our company’s awareness and support with the engagement among target audiences. The applicant should be a strong writer who is comfortable working independently, has excellent organizational and planning skills, and a positive attitude. This position allows for a flexible schedule to accommodate class schedules.Responsibilities will include: Creating concise, eye-catching, and innovative headlines and body copyResearching and organizing facts and sourcesInterviewing subject matter expertsBrainstorming and collaborating with the team for new ideas and strategiesGrowing our brand following on social media with creative workResearching markets and industries to compare and create content that is innovative and originalWriting a wide variety of topics for multiple platforms (website, blogs, social updates, ad copy, case studies, guides, whitepapers, etc.)While this position begins as an unpaid internship, there is immense room for growth and upward movement to a paid position within the company.Job Type: InternshipSalary: $0.00 /hour

Title: USA TODAY Spring 2019 Interactive Graphics Internship – Mclean, VA
Description:
Temporary, InternshipAbout Gannett

Gannett Co., Inc. (NYSE: GCI) is an innovative, digitally focused media and marketing solutions company committed to strengthening communities across our network. With an unmatched local-to-national reach, Gannett touches the lives of more than 110 million people monthly with our Pulitzer-Prize winning content, consumer experiences and benefits, and advertiser products and services. Gannett brands include USA TODAY NETWORK with the iconic USA TODAY and more than 100 local media brands, digital marketing services companies ReachLocal and SweetIQ, and U.K. media company Newsquest. To connect with us, visit www.gannett.com.

USA TODAY Spring 2019 Interactive Graphics Internship – Mclean, VA
USA TODAY is looking for visual journalists to join their Pulitzer Prize winning Graphics desk. You will find stories and present them using the web as your medium. You will inform modem audiences in easily understood, visually interesting ways using words, animations, maps, diagrams, charts, interactive experiences and emerging story forms. You will work both independently and collaboratively on stories of all kinds, from your own ambitious ideas to our biggest enterprise work and investigations. Work may range from quick-turn graphics produced in less than a day to longer-range projects.

The ideal candidate will excel at telling stories with data, presenting information in visually compelling ways that appeal to mobile-focused audiences. This staffer should be skilled at analyzing and synthesizing data, creating visual elements with graphic design software and code. You will be expected to evaluate sources of all kinds, work with complex data, evaluate it quickly, and get it right - accuracy of work is a must.

You will...

Work directly with a Pulitzer Prize winning team of journalists, designers and developers.
Tackle a wide range of work - from breaking stories to data visualizations to ambitious enterprise projects.
Constantly learn and improve your skills, both within your discipline and across the board.
Do some good for the world, and produce quality work while you are at it.
Be free to pitch your own stories and project ideas.

You must...

Care about our audience, and our mission to inform.
Be flexible, have optimistic attitude, an open mind, and lots of ideas.
Have excellent verbal, written, and visual communications skills.
Be comfortable working quickly, independently, and in tight collaboration, with hard deadlines.
Have superior research, reporting, and editing skills.
Be able to develop and evaluate sources of all kinds.
Be familiar with the web as a medium - this means HTML, CSS and JS.

Extra credit for...

Experience working in media, especially online journalism.
Experience with Data-scraping and statistical analysis languages like Python, R, and QGIS.
Experience with Database technologies such as SQL, Postgres, Couchbase, etc.
Familiarity with data visualization software and libraries, including Mapbox, D3, three.js, etc.
Experience in 3D modeling, mapping, photography, videography, emerging technology.
Comfort with GitHub.

We need someone with the creative and technical skills to do the work. But we also want someone with a watchdog reporter's sensibility -- who is comfortable questioning authority, whose curiosity won't let her/him take "no" for an answer and who is hungry to try new things.

If this sounds like you, please apply including a resume and samples from the projects you are most proud of.

Title: Research Internship (Spring/Summer 2019, Ph.D. candidates)
Description:
Temporary, InternshipType: Full Time
Experience: All Levels

Who we are:
We are Dataminr; we transform vast social media feeds into real-time, actionable alerts. Our clients are the first to know about high-impact events and critical breaking information, enabling them to act faster and stay one step ahead.

Our groundbreaking technology detects, classifies, and determines the significance of public information. We have revolutionized the way relevant information reaches the right people in corporate security, news, the public sector, and finance.

Along the way, we've been referred to as the "super tool of journalists and hedge funds" while also receiving numerous awards and accolades from our clients, including being recognized by CNBC as one of the world's 50 most disruptive private technology companies in 2016 and being named to the definitive list of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world by Forbes in 2017.

Based in NYC, a career at Dataminr offers the ability to make an individual impact at a rapidly growing tech startup while being supported by the experience of a company founded in 2009, backed by the world's leading venture and growth technology investors, and 400 talented employees around the globe.

Who you are:
You're a Ph.D. candidate who has published in top tier conferences and are passionate about having a positive impact on the world. You are enthusiastic about working on some of the most challenging problems in AI, working in a highly collaborative environment and directly contributing to products while advancing the state of the art. You are very creative, can work independently, and are an excellent collaborator and communicator.

Responsibilities:

Perform research to advance the state of the art and solve specific problems at scale in one or more of the following areas: NLP, HCI, Machine Learning/Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Complex Networks.
Work closely with a diverse, interdisciplinary team on a specific project to be completed during the internship.
Excel in placing a human-centered focus on the work (context, end-user impact, etc), finding solutions that work in practice and have significant impact.

Minimum qualifications:

Must be enrolled in a Ph.D. program in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related field.
Ideal candidates will have had prior internship experience.
Outstanding publication record in the candidate's field of study (CVPR, CHI, WWW, RecSys, ICCV, NIPS, ICML, etc.).
Demonstrated ability to work independently, set up experiments and demonstrate progress through principled used of metrics.

Our offering of competitive benefits and perks include:

Company paid benefits for employees and their dependents, such as medical, dental, vision, disability and life
Flexible spending account to be used for out-of-pocket medical, transit, parking and dependent care expenses
401(k) savings plan
Generous leave
Daily catered lunch
A kitchen fully stocked with snacks and beverages
Discounted Gym Membership

Note: For this role, only candidates with Ph.D.s in the areas above will be considered. If you do not meet that requirement please consider either the Data Scientist or other positions.

Dataminr is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Individuals seeking employment at Dataminr are considered without regards to race, sex, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, genetics, marital status, pregnancy, unemployment status, sexual orientation, citizenship status or veteran status.

We continually develop technology to transform information into insight and prosperity. From over 50 countries and in over a dozen languages, we enlighten and inspire audiences with authoritative, differentiated and trusted content.
http://www.dowjones.com/careers/     Android Developer     26-Oct-18  jobsDB Ref. JHK100003006587113         Tools    Save this Job      Share      Print this Job Ad      Report this Job       We are now seeking a high caliber candidate to fill the following vacancy in Hong Kong.
Android Developer
Our mobile engineering team is responsible for Dow Jones mobile apps including the Wall Street Journal, Barron's, and Factiva applications. Our goal is to deliver content promptly and reliably as we experiment with new storytelling technologies. We rank 11 out of 12 on the Joel Test (http://www.joelonsoftware.com/articles/fog0000000043.html).
We are known for having the world’s best journalists and most expansive set of content. We are looking for versatile Android Engineers to join our team and become part of our evolving technology department.  This is an opportunity to act as change agents and create a 21st century product development team around our content. Like everyone else in our organization you will be empowered to own your set of products. You will engage and collaborate with key stakeholders in creating and executing a vision, as well as supporting the results.
As a mobile engineer, you'll be part of a small agile team that will build a suite of libraries and apps that will raise the bar for mobile journalism. You won't just be building single-purpose brick-and-mortar apps, you'll be crafting polished digital experiences.
Responsibilities:

Work closely with product and design to help us build a suite of apps for Android
Strong programming and engineering abilities and experience with Java and the Android SDK
Communicating effectively with your team, both by using natural language and by writing clear and concise code
Being ruthlessly pragmatic about what gets built and how it gets built, without compromising on quality (quality is a feature)!
Take ownership and being responsible for some of the many projects we'll be building in the coming year

 General Experience:

Formal Computer Science education (B.S. or M.S.) or equivalent experience
Public technical writing of any kind (personal blog, articles, etc) a plus
Experience with design and implementation of complex business applications in a team environment
Individual must be independent and not require a lot of direction.  This person should be able to jump in and hit the ground running.  They should have a good, positive, fun attitude.  
Individual should be able to articulate and creative.
Individual should have solid development life cycle experience.
Candidates should be prepared to provide code samples and demonstrate applications they have worked on.

Technical Skills:

2+ years’ experience in Android development
Strong Java skills
Familiarity with Java 8.0 a plus
Able to work in a rapid and agile development environment with frequent deliveries.
Proficiency with client-server architectures, efficient local data storage, caching mechanisms, Services and background tasks
Experience with editorial layouts and managing complex data schemes a plus
Fluency with Object-Oriented and MVC programming models
Fluency with multi-threaded programming styles and approaches
An understanding of relational database schema design, queries, and optimization techniques
Experience with JavaScript, HTML5 technologies a plus
At least one published app in the Google Play Store

Dow Jones offers an opportunity to work for one of the world's leading financial and business news companies. We invite interested candidates to submit a cover letter and detailed resume, current and expected salary via:
https://dowjones.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/Dow_Jones_Career/job/Hong-Kong/Android-Developer_Job_Req_13706

Title: Lead Manager, Media Relations (Corporate Development Division) (Ref: CDD213/JDB/221018)
Description:
Hong Kong Productivity Council    The mission of the Hong Kong Productivity Council (HKPC) is to promote productivity excellence for industry to enhance competitiveness and sustainability through a bundle of strategies including collaboration with stakeholders, focus on areas of excellence and scaling up productivity enhancement platforms.     Lead Manager, Media Relations (Corporate Development Division) (Ref: CDD213/JDB/221018)     22-Oct-18  jobsDB Ref. JHK100003006575784   Employer Ref. CDD213/JDB/221018      Tools    Save this Job      Share      Print this Job Ad      Report this Job       HKPC is looking for an experienced Lead Manager of Media Relations, as a key member in the Corporate Communications Unit of the Corporate Development Division, in managing the media strategy and implementing all media initiatives to enhance the media relations and promote HKPC’s leadership and brand image through earned publicity.
Job Duties: 

Devise effective media strategy and plans covering both traditional and new media platforms to effectively promote the HKPC’s brand publicity and press exposure aligning the Council’s business objectives.
Develop and maintain positive relationship with local, regional and global media in Hong Kong covering print, electronic, social and online streams, to build long-term business partnership with such media stakeholders.
Work closely with different business divisions and branches in the Council to pitch for positive media coverage and branded stories with compelling news angles to increase earned publicity.
Work hand in hand with the digital communications team to drive HKPC’s brand awareness and publicity on social channels.
Propose, manage and implement media engagement initiatives including but not limited to press conferences, media gatherings, product and service media briefings, media workshops, tours, one-on-one interviews, day-to-day media communications and support, etc.
Manage and handle media enquiries via designated media hotline and email as well as other corporate channels, prepare article write-ups for thematic columns in key media channels and industry publications, prepare replies to customer or media complaints.
Solicit feature and profile interview opportunities for senior executives to build thought leadership and increase brand awareness via media publicity.
Responsible for annual media audit and media training programmes for the Council’s spokespersons.
Develop and maintain the corporate messaging guide to facilitate effective and consistent media communications for the Council.
Manage media stakeholders’ database.
Develop press materials, boilerplate, factsheet and LTT for media engagement and issue management purposes.
Lead the market intelligence monitoring, reporting and analysis through digital media tools to facilitate management decision in a timely manner.
Manage and monitor media coverage to increase PR publicity value benchmarking with YoY comparison.
Manage and update senior executive profile for the Council’s management and spokesperson.
Cultivate and enhance relationships with influencers and KOLs.
Manage the master media calendar for the Council.

Job Requirements: 

Bachelor degree or above in Communications, Marketing, Public Relations Translation, language studies or other discipline as deemed fit.
At least 8 years’ experience with all-rounded exposure to Corporate Communications functions, with at least three years at managerial position.
Experienced in formulation and execution of media communications strategies and measures. Excellent project management skills.
Expertise in media relation, digital communications (including social media) with outstanding story pitching skills.
Excellent communication and writing skills with high proficiency in spoken and written English and Chinese (Cantonese and Mandarin)
Technology and social media savvy, a subject matter expert on media relations with solid media network of all press beats.
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure and to tight timelines.
Journalistic experience as reporter or editor with also in-house PR experience highly advantageous.
A solution provider with strategic mindset, positive can-do attitude and acute business sense to achieve business goals. Ability to work with people at all levels and drive cross-department collaboration and business results.
Hands-on and detail-oriented, result and quality driven. Able to handle multi tasks and deliver quality work in a fast-paced business environment, deadline conscious
Demonstrated analytical, problem solving and decision-making abilities while being a good team player who enjoys supporting others.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, PowerPoint, Excel, HTML, WordPress, email campaign systems, social platforms and Adobe Design Suite a definite advantage.
Resourceful, creative and willing to go extra miles to achieve greater outcome.
Hardworking, have strong attention to detail as a prerequisite.
Willing to learn and open to new ideas, able to think outside the square and bring in new ideas, contribute with enthusiasm and initiative.
Applicants with less experience or not matching all the requirements of the subject role, will be considered for manager position.

Applications: 
HKPC will take into consideration both the quantitative and qualitative requirements of the post when selecting the suitable candidates. A competitive salary package commensurate with academic qualifications and experience will be offered. The successful candidates will be employed on a fixed-term contract basis, which is renewable subject to appointee’s performance and the Council’s development needs.
Applicants should send application, together with a detailed resume, current and expected salary and contact telephone number by clicking "Apply Now" (quoting the reference number on the subject heading) on or before 5 November 2018.
Applications not quoting reference number will lead to late processing.
Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only. Candidates not invited for interviews within 6 weeks may consider their applications unsuccessful and the applications will be disposed by HKPC within 12 months.
